page.title: 06 Beck Row Village Hall
page.content: Beck Row Village Hall was built in 1830 and is constructed of flint with a pantile roof. It was originally built as a Chapel or Place of Worship, and purchased by public subscription and a tablet near the base of the building marked P.M. stands for Primitive Methodist. Just above the foundation level,many initials are inscribed and also the names of the trustees when it was built. The building is still in the care of trustees,who are represented on the recently formed Community Association who are raising funds to build a new Community Centre either on the site of the existing hall or on another site behind the School. The Village Hall is used for various functions such as whist drives,jumble sales,village meetings,discos,over 60 club and many other activities.
